hypothesis_content.title: Bull-to-Neutral Transition on Volatility Regime Shift & Volume Divergence
hypothesis_content.statement: During BULL regimes, if BTC price makes a new 30-day high but 10-day average volume declines > 20% from prior 10-day period, and 20-day realized volatility crosses below 50-day realized volatility, regime transitions to NEUTRAL within 7 days with 70% probability. Reducing long exposure at signal avoids drawdown.
hypothesis_content.rationale: New highs on declining volume suggest weakening participation. Volatility regime shift (short-term vol falling below medium-term) indicates momentum loss. Combined, these signal exhaustion before consolidation/neutral phase. Regulatory news (UK) may accelerate profit-taking.
entry_conditions: 10-day avg volume < prior 10-day avg volume by > 20%

exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC price makes another new 30-day high on expanding volume

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If price continues rally > 15% post-signal without entering NEUTRAL regime within 14 days.
